metadata.title: CVE-2020-26147 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 5.8.9. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, andWPA3 implementations reassemble fragments even though some of them weresent in plaintext. This vulnerability can be abused to inject packetsand/or exfiltrate selected fragments when another device sends fragmentedframes and the WEP, CCMP, or GCMP data-confidentiality protocol is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required
